quote_snippets.num_tested_probands: The patient was the only proband tested in this report.
quote_snippets.text: The patient, following informed and written consent, under the protocol 76-HG-0238, “Diagnosis and Treatment of Patients with Inborn Errors of Metabolism or Other Genetic Disorders” of the NIH-UDP.

quote_snippets.num_positive_het_probands: No probands were reported to be heterozygous for a pathogenic variant.
quote_snippets.text: Clinical data and patient samples were obtained in accordance with the ethical standards approved by the National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI) Institutional Review Board (IRB).

quote_snippets.positive_phenotypes: The patient presented with infantile-onset, Levodopa-responsive Parkinsonism, which is a clinical hallmark of Parkinson's disease.
quote_snippets.text: Levodopa-responsive Parkinsonism presenting in infancy or child-hood is extraordinarily rare and may occur as a comorbidity to other diseases or genetic conditions.

quote_snippets.num_compound_or_double_hets: One compound/heterozygous mutation was reported in the WARS2 gene.
quote_snippets.text: Here, we describe a patient with pathogenic WARS2 mutations presenting with infantile-onset, Levodopa-responsive Parkinsonism.

quote_snippets.num_tested_probands: The patient was the first and only child born to non-consanguineous parents, indicating that there is no family history of genetic disorders.
quote_snippets.text: The patient was the first and only child born to non-consanguineous parents of European descent with no relevant family history.

quote_snippets.num_positive_het_probands: No proband was found to be heterozygous for a pathogenic variant.
quote_snippets.text: Mitochondrial and nuclear DNA copy numbers were performed by a clinical lab using real-time quantitative PCR (qPCR) specific primers for the mitochondrial tRNALeu(UUR) (MT-TL1) gene and the nuclear β-2-micoglobulin (β2M) gene.

quote_snippets.positive_phenotypes: The patient exhibited symptoms of infantile-onset Parkinsonism and intellectual disability.
quote_snippets.text: Early development was normal until the age of 1 when he was first noted to have left leg tremor while learning to stand. At 18 months, the left leg tremor spread to his right leg and he was noted to have expressive language delay despite good receptive language skills.

quote_snippets.num_compound_or_double_hets: The patient was compound heterozygous for two variants in the WARS2 gene.
quote_snippets.text: Specifically, the patient was compound heterozygous for 2 variants in WARS2 (NM_015836.3): a missense variant c.37T>G (p.Trp13Gly) that was inherited from his mother and a missense variant c.683C>G (p.Ser228Trp) that was inherited from his father.

quote_snippets.num_tested_probands: The patient is the only proband tested in this report.
quote_snippets.text: The latest mtARS to be linked to a disease is WARS2, based upon 2 independent case reports. Musante et al9 described 2 sib-lings with moderate delayed psychomotor development, speech impairment, ataxia, and athetoid movements.

quote_snippets.num_positive_het_probands: No proband was found to be heterozygous for a pathogenic variant.
quote_snippets.text: Numerous publications have documented significant phenotypic variability caused by defects in mtARS genes.6,7 Patients harboring bialle-lic mutation in AARS2, for example, may present with intrauterine or perinatal cardiomyopathy,20 adolescent onset ovario leukodystro-phy21 or late-onset neurodegeneration in patients with hereditary diffuse leukoencephalopathy with spheroids (HDLS).22

quote_snippets.positive_phenotypes: The patient has infantile-onset Parkinsonism and Levodopa-responsive Parkinsonism, according to the clinical presentation described in the report.
quote_snippets.text: Here, we present a fourth patient with compound heterozygous mutations in WARS2 and a clinical presentation of infantile-onset, Levodopa-responsive Parkinsonism. While the clinical presentations vary substantially among the reported WARS2 cases and our own patient, there are some shared similarities.
